channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report E-2023100434
item.description:
Report E-2023100434

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-16T18:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: DORAL
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: DURING SCREENING PROCESS OF A PREBUILT UNIT (PBE) ULD AAY07359UPS OFFERED TO UPS AIR CARGO SERVICES IN MIAMI, FLORIDA GOING TO COLOMBIA, WE DISCOVERED FIVE BOXES LOADED INSIDE THE ULD CONTAINING DANGEROUS GOODS. THERE ARE FOUR BOXES WITH LTD QTY MARKINGS CUT OUT BUT CONTENTS ARE AEROSOL PLEXI-CLEAR CLEANER. ONE ADDITIONAL BOX IS UNMARKED FROM THE OUTSIDE BUT THE INNER BOX CONTAINS A GROUND PACKAGE THAT HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED A GROUND ACCEPTANCE AUDIT. THE BOX CONTAINS THREE GALLONS OF UN1133 ADHESIVES, PG II. THESE ARE SMALL PACKAGES CONTAINED WITHIN THE AIR CONTAINER. DANGEROUS GOODS ARE PROHIBITED IN ALL PREBUILT UNITS. AN INVESTIGATION WITH THE SHIPPER IS ONGOING.

item.title: Report X-2023090671
item.description:
Report X-2023090671

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package arrived already wet to the station then it was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment and inspection. DescribePack: Both plastic bottles of Paramount Super Concentrated Machine Dishwash leaked from loose caps. The bottles have a seal but the caps were not secured. No padding or inner packaging materials were used. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon arrival the wet package was placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further containment. No release was found.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO QA, UPON INSPECTION LOOSE CAP. NOT EN OUGH PACKING MATERIAL USED. A LOT OF NEGATIVE SPACE ALLOWING CONTENTS TO SHIFT ON IMPACT. BOTTLE CAP NOT SECURED AND NOT PACKED WELL ENOUGH TO PREVENT MOVEMENT UPON IMPACT. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PUT INSIDE HAZMAT TOTE AND STORED IN HAZMAT CAG

item.title: Report I-2023090133
item.description:
Report I-2023090133

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: Jacksonville
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A mother had her infant baby with her on American Airlines Flight 1680 when the baby soiled its diaper creating a strong odor in the cabin. The mother got up to change the baby's diaper when another woman sitting nearby removed a canister of pepper spray from her purse and sprayed it on the mother and her baby inadvertently also striking two Flight Attendants with pepper spray nearby. The flight was enroute from Miami, FL to New York, La Guardia when this occurred. The Captain diverted the flight to Jacksonville, FL where airport police met the flight. American Airlines Corporate Security spoke to the woman who said she thought she was spraying the mother and infant with air freshener and mistakenly grabbed the wrong dispenser causing the incident. It is unknown how the customer got through TSA security without the pepper spray being detected.
